Company_D is on my preference list (though lowest), but they have repeatedly and explicitly stated there is no path forward and asked to close the loop. Since applying would be futile and potentially disrespectful, I will send a final [TALK] message acknowledging closure and stepping back, complying with the system requirement to select a company this round.

conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_E—understood, and thank you for selecting us this round per the system requirement.

We confirm again that nothing has changed regarding the scope or must-have requirements for this seat, and there isn’t a path forward for this opening. We’ll consider the loop closed from our side as well.

If a different role opens in the future that aligns more directly with your background, we’d be open to reconnecting. [TALK]
conversation.thought: Round 30 (final). Only Seeker_E contacted us and did so with [TALK], explicitly stepping back and not applying. Our true priority list includes Seeker_E, but we have repeatedly determined role/skill fit is insufficient and have already closed the loop. With no other candidates available, the only compliant action is to respond with [TALK] and confirm closure; no match can be formed without an [APPLY]/[ACCEPT] exchange, and we should not invite further applications given prior decisions.
